definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
an express train sets off/fig. to work in haste/to rush

sentences.english: Steve is a high- stepping motorist.
sentences.chinese: 史提夫是一個開快車的駕車者。

sentences.english: His horse, Eastern Express, seemed ready to run and win the race.
sentences.chinese: 他的坐騎“東方快車”顯得狀態頗佳。

sentences.english: The express is as swift as an arrow.
I have send a carton - The Polar Express.
sentences.chinese: 這裏有北極特快車完整版的電影配樂試聽。

sentences.english: The London to Edinburgh express steamed into Newcastle fight on time.
sentences.chinese: 從倫敦到愛丁堡的快車準時駛抵紐卡斯爾。

sentences.english: What platform does the limited express for Los Angeles depart from?
sentences.chinese: 往洛杉磯的特快車在幾站臺？

sentences.english: This is a good quality highway，and very wide.
sentences.chinese: 這是一條很高級的快車道，而且很寬。

sentences.english: Which platform is for the guangzhou special express, please?
sentences.chinese: 請問去廣州的特快車在哪個站臺上車？

sentences.english: The express runs every day between Beijing and Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 在北京與上海之間每天都有快車行駛。

sentences.english: My friend and I returned to town by the midnight express.
sentences.chinese: 我和我朋友乘午夜的快車回城。

sentences.english: I reflected that there must be a great many people besides myself who wished to take advantage of this excellent service.
sentences.chinese: 我想除我之外，想利用快車之便的也一定大有人在。

sentences.english: This, then, is why kids are driving slowly.
sentences.chinese: 這就是爲什麼孩子不開快車了。

sentences.english: How long will this express take to go to Shanghai？
sentences.chinese: 這列直達快車開到上海要多久？

sentences.english: Where can I transfer to the uptown express?
sentences.chinese: 我在哪裏換車到上城區快車？

sentences.english: Driving fast is no longer a rite of passage.
sentences.chinese: 開快車不再是一種駕駛習慣。

sentences.english: I want to GO by limited express.

definition: shuttle bus ferrying passengers between train stations on two different rail lines
to go nonstop to/through (as in "through train")/nonstop
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
to transfer/to change trains, buses etc
special (or reserved) train (or bus etc)/limousine/private car used as a taxi and booked via a smartphone app
"through train" (refers to the idea of retaining previous legislature after transition to Chinese rule in Hong Kong or Macao)
special-purpose phone line or communications link/hotline/special rail line (e.g. between airport and city)/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
train or coach service ("service" as in "they run 12 services per day between the two cities")
